root.title: History of AI
root.content:
The History of Artificial Intelligence

The journey of AI is marked by ambitious goals, significant breakthroughs, and periods of disillusionment. This timeline covers the major milestones and pioneers who shaped the field.

foundations.title: Early Foundations (1943-1955)
foundations.content:
Early Foundations

The groundwork for AI was laid by pioneers like Alan Turing, who proposed the 'Turing Test' to measure a machine's intelligence, and McCulloch & Pitts, who created the first mathematical model of a neuron.

quiz.question: What test was proposed by Alan Turing to determine if a machine can exhibit intelligent behavior indistinguishable from that of a human?

birth-of-ai.title: The Birth of AI (1956)
birth-of-ai.content:
The Dartmouth Workshop

The term 'Artificial Intelligence' was coined by John McCarthy at the Dartmouth Summer Research Project on Artificial Intelligence. This event is widely considered the birthplace of AI as a field.

golden-years.title: The Golden Years (1956-1974)
golden-years.content:
The Golden Years

A period of great enthusiasm and funding. Early programs demonstrated that computers could solve algebra word problems, prove theorems in logic, and speak English. The LISP programming language was invented.

ai-winter.title: The First AI Winter (1974-1980)
ai-winter.content:
The First AI Winter

Progress stalled as the initial excitement led to overblown promises. The difficulty of real-world problems was underestimated, leading to major cuts in funding and a period of reduced interest.

quiz.question: What was the 'AI Winter'?
options: A conference held in a cold climate.
quiz.answer: A period of reduced funding and interest in AI research.

expert-systems.title: Boom of Expert Systems (1980s)
expert-systems.content:
The Rise of Expert Systems

AI saw a resurgence with the commercial success of 'expert systems' â€“ programs that emulated the decision-making ability of a human expert in a specific domain. This led to a new wave of investment.

deep-learning-era.title: The Deep Learning Era (2010s-Present)
deep-learning-era.content:
The Deep Learning Revolution

Fueled by massive datasets (like ImageNet), powerful GPUs, and algorithmic breakthroughs, Deep Learning has led to astonishing progress. Pioneers like Geoffrey Hinton, Yann LeCun, and Yoshua Bengio (the 'Godfathers of AI') won the Turing Award for their work on neural networks.
